column4: Who here can help someone with a seemingly unsolvable problem!!!???
So check it
My friends hard drive is fried, so im trying to boot Ubuntu onto the pc from a Flash drive.
Possible correct?
It does
Now then
I have the flash correctly set up
easy plug and play maybe some bios setting to enable usb boot
message that states what?  might be it tries to boot from hard disk first so will fail,  change the boot sequence so usb boots first
so you will have to boot into bios setting mode to change boot sequence
is this ubuntu?
can the usb flash disk boot on any other systems?
does the usb flash boot on another computer?  what software method did you use to install the iso file on the usb flash disk?
and reading back I don't see what version you have installed.  if you have a system to program the usb flash you should try to test the usb flash boot on that system to isolate the problem
version of ubuntu iso's you tried
well then have them try it on the system you use as the remote
I've never seen your problem so I would have to first isolate
oh then maybe you might need something like a 32bit lubuntu iso to test it on that also
I would start from lubuntu 10.04  32bit  and work up from there if needed
a 2001 system I don't think will boot a standard ubuntu 10.04  probly not enuf mem
oh 2010 hp could be a it has an efi bios,  I wonder how those boot from usb
